author: Max Colchester
title: U.K. Regulator Holds Firm on Bank Segregation Plan
text:
LONDON—A U.K. regulator Thursday held firm on a law to force banks to segregate their retail and investment banking operations, setting the stage for more painful restructuring at British lenders.
Big U.K. banks are required to separate their retail banks from investment-banking activities by 2019 in a bid to ensure depositors and small businesses aren’t put at risk if a lender’s investment banking operations fail.
